definition: to conclude a case/to wind up
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)

sentences.english: After be like formalities all ready, insurance company should be compensated for in end a case inside 10 days.
sentences.chinese: 若手續齊備後，保險公司應在10天內一次結案賠償。

sentences.english: The final report should also include answers to the grant-specific questions.
sentences.chinese: 結案報告也需要包括補助金特定問題的答案。

sentences.english: Only 932 cases were settled through arbitration, about 6 percent of the total decided cases.
sentences.chinese: 而仲裁裁決結案只有932起，只佔總結案數的6%。

sentences.english: been closed for two years. That perp is dead.
sentences.chinese: 已經結案兩年了，兇手已經死了。

sentences.english: Like the opening statement, the closing argument is a speech to the jury.
sentences.chinese: 如同開庭陳詞一樣，結案陳詞的對象也是陪審團。

sentences.english: The prosecutor’s role ends when he gives a closing argument at the completion of a trial.
sentences.chinese: 公訴人的作用到他在庭審結束時作結案陳詞後即終止。

sentences.english: I feel the same way, particularly when I am negotiating a transaction and trying to close a deal.
sentences.chinese: 我深有同感，尤其是在我協商交易並努力結案的時候。

sentences.english: Seeing no need for summoning more witnesses for interrogation, the court intends to close the case soon.
sentences.chinese: 法庭認爲沒有必要傳訊更多的證人，打算在近期結案。

sentences.english: Ensure that the MOC has been properly implemented, communicated, and closed out.
sentences.chinese: 確保MOC已被正確實施，溝通和結案。

sentences.english: This is now swelling dockets, delaying cases, and reducing access to the legal system.
sentences.chinese: 這是增多的訴訟，延遲的結案和低效的法律體系。

sentences.english: Many crimes could not be solved without using forensic medicine.
sentences.chinese: 沒有法醫學，很多犯罪案件無法結案。

definition: to make a formal request/formal request/to make a claim (law)
to file away/to place on file
to expose (e.g., wrongdoing)/to accuse (in court)/to impeach/to denounce
preliminary hearing/interrogation (of a suspect)/preliminary examination (of a project etc)
